title: Ganzoni Equation for Iron Deficiency Anemia
description: Assesses total body iron deficit for iron replacement therapy. Calculates the precise amount of iron needed to replenish body iron stores and correct hemoglobin levels in patients with iron deficiency anemia.

parameters.name: body_weight
parameters.description: Patient's body weight in kilograms. Must be ≥35 kg for accurate calculation

parameters.name: current_hemoglobin
parameters.description: Patient's current hemoglobin level in g/dL

parameters.name: target_hemoglobin
parameters.description: Target hemoglobin level in g/dL. Typically 15 g/dL for adults, may be lower based on clinical judgment

parameters.name: iron_stores
parameters.description: Iron stores to be replenished in mg. Typically 500 mg for adults (minimum for small women), may be modified based on patient factors

result.name: iron_deficit
result.description: Total iron deficit in milligrams requiring replacement

ranges.interpretation: Mild iron deficiency. Consider oral iron therapy or single IV iron infusion.
Moderate iron deficiency requiring iron replacement therapy. IV iron preferred if oral not tolerated.
Significant iron deficiency requiring IV iron replacement therapy in divided doses.
Very severe iron deficiency requiring high-dose IV iron replacement therapy administered over multiple sessions.

references: Ganzoni AM. Intravenous iron-dextran: therapeutic and experimental possibilities. Schweiz Med Wochenschr. 1970;100(7):301-3. (German)
Auerbach M, Adamson JW. How we diagnose and treat iron deficiency anemia. Am J Hematol. 2016;91(1):31-8. doi: 10.1002/ajh.24201.
Camaschella C. Iron-deficiency anemia. N Engl J Med. 2015;372(19):1832-43. doi: 10.1056/NEJMra1401038.
formula: Iron deficit (mg) = body weight (kg) × (target Hb - current Hb) (g/dL) × 2.4 + iron stores (mg)
notes: Formula factor 2.4 = 0.0034 × 0.07 × 10,000 (iron content of Hb × blood volume × conversion factor)
Standard target hemoglobin is 15 g/dL for adults, but may be adjusted based on age, gender, and comorbidities
Iron stores typically 500 mg for adults; represents minimum iron stores for small women
MUST NOT be used for patients under 35 kg body weight - formula not validated in this population
Result represents cumulative iron dose needed for complete iron repletion
Most adults require at least 1000 mg cumulative elemental iron for complete repletion
Iron replacement usually done intravenously (iron-dextran, iron sucrose, or ferric carboxymaltose)
Formula may overestimate needs in patients with chronic kidney disease or inflammation
Consider modified formula (without iron stores) if transferrin saturation >20% and ferritin >50 ng/mL
Monitor hemoglobin response and iron parameters during treatment to avoid iron overload
